review: Patient, thoughtful, thorough and caring -- highly recommend him!

Dr Mandelburg is a fantastic doctor, he diagnosed our daughter with autism and the level of care, consideration, knowledge and attention to detail that he showed during the process was exceptional, we are so grateful to have his help and ongoing support with our daughter. We would highly recommend him.

We are forever grateful for Dr. Mandelberg's care of our son! He has worked with our son since he was 9 months old and now he is four. He is extremely thorough from various evaluations to interviewing current teachers and interventionists and listening to the concerns of the parents and grandparents. Additionally, he is very organized in putting together his assessment and recommendations for continued care. We have seen great improvement in our son's development and will continue to see Dr. Mandelberg to track it. It's also extremely helpful that his assistant is kind, caring and thoughtful. Truly a gem of a team!

No parent would ever want to hear that their child has a disorder, specially one that does not have a cure. Dr. Mandelberg is the beacon of hope that each family needs. His diagnosis is based on an extensive and thorough assessment that is not rushed and as if you are getting something from a drive-through window. Instead it is well organized and put together. It is build around the child's strength while at the same time pointing a complete list of how to focus on all areas of opportunity so the child would start receiving the appropriate help and therapy that is required and beneficial.
Dr. Mandelberg not only looks at the issue as a dedicated and caring physician but also puts himself as the parent and care giver of the child by trying to plan the best care possible for the child while protecting and preserving the child's innocence.
You hear cliche that there are angels on earth among us, and I am sure it is true and Dr. Mandelberg is one of them.
Dr. Mandelberg is thorough and thoughtful. He takes the time and care to really get to know your child. He goes above and beyond as a doctor.
Dr Mandelberg has been a great help - we would recommend him to anyone!
Dr. Mandelberg has been amazing to work with!!! He is compassionate and insightful. He instantly made friends with our son:-) We are happy to have him on our team!!! Just a lovely person!!!
Dr Mandelberg has been a great doctor for my son. He has been so helpful in our journey since my son was diagnosed with autism. He always replies to my questions in a timely manner.

Dr. Josh is truly a Godsend. Realizing you have a child with special needs is a very emotional, uncertain and scary time but Dr. Josh’s kindness, intelligence, knowledge, and attentiveness helped calm our feasr. Instead of giving our son a basic assessment and blanket diagnosis he took the time to interview our son’s speech therapist, occupational therapist, behavioral therapist and teachers. He also assessed and visited our son at school. He got to the underlying issue of our son’s delay and presented a thorough report with excellent resources to get our son up to speed. Dr. Josh is extremely well known well respected in the community so he was also able to get our son spots in various programs that are nearly impossible to get in. He is an excellent resource with impeccable bedside manner who always makes himself available to his patients. I really can’t say enough positive things about him. I work in the medical field so I visit many Physicians day in and day out and Dr. Josh is by far the BEST.

We are extremely happy with Dr Mandelberg's office and his team. They are all very knowledgeable, extremely nice and accommodating. Dr Josh diagned my son with ASD when he was 2yrs and 4 months, he is very insightful and knowledgeable, calls me back within a day if I have any urgent questions and responds to all my emails in a timely manner. I feel like I have a great advocate for my child's needs and, in a situation where it is difficult to get a great advice, I trust Dr Mandelberg’s recommendation on any subject related to my son’s condition. I have already recommended him to anybody who might benefit from his services.
We are extremely happy with everything, if he was working with insurance we probably be even more happy but otherwise his entire team is wonderful and we feel very lucky to have the opportunity to be in his care.
Highly recommend. Very knowledgeable and thorough when examining
First time visit was great. Everybody was friendly and professional. ..
She was very kind and helpful. First time visit was great!

Doctor Patel was very thorough with my daughter's exam. She addressed all concerns and explained all charts. Provide great advise. Her staff was friendly and made my daughter feel at ease after three vaccines and blood drawn. Great overall first time experience with Dr. Patel.

Great office, doctor, & staff. Everyone is very nice and helpful. Professional and fast. Dr. Patel is a very sweet doctor. She always answers our questions and my baby is very comfortable with her. Nurse and receptionist are very nice as well.

Dr. Patel is passionate about her work and took time to listen to everything we asked about and answer questions and concerns thoroughly. You can see how she loves her work by how interacts with patients and parents. We are very pleased to have Dr. Patel as our children's primary doctor.
Overall satisfied with the services. They are fast, friendly and professional.
Very helpful!! It was completely perfect I have nothing but good things to say.
She is excellent Doctor. My daughter felt happy for the first time to be at the doctor's office .
Great doctor very personal and extremely knowledgeable
We live 20 miles away but our children still are seen by Dr. Sloninsky. She and the rest of the doctors and nurses are terrific. They're all very knowledgeable, caring and practical.

She has always been professional and informative, and knowing she'd tell me everything about my children's health assures me to trust her. The other doctors in the office are great, too, but Dr. Sloninsky is the most caring, wonderful doctor of all.

My children adore Dr Sloninsky. She is total pro and a sweetheart. My son was admitted to Cedars a few ago and she came by to check on us and see if everything was going well. VERY highly reccomend her . The other doctors in the office are

I have been a patient of Dr. Sloninsky for 18 years and she has been great, very nice and caring. She talks to you without judgement and is very sincere. Wish I could stay with her but i have to move on, because she only sees children under 18. The atmosphere is comforting, she always stopped in to say hello even when she wasn't seeing me specifically.
Wonderful bedside manner. Caring and knowledgable. The front office is very friendly. Highly recommend this office
We have been with Dr. Sloninsky since my son was born. She is very caring and knowledgeable, one of the best doctors we've ever seen. My son loves her, too.

The first time my wife and I saw Dr. Sloninsky was a day after our son was born when she appeared to do his examination. Dr. Sloninsky immediately won our confidence with her intellect. As a scientist and a concerned parent, I insist upon knowing what is medical status of my child, why something may be happening and how to treat it. Moreover, I demand that his physician be thoroughly knowledgeable and intelligent in his or her field. From this perspective, Dr. Sloninsky is fantastic. She is superb at diagnosing problems and giving realistic assessments. Additionally, she shows a great deal of care with her patients. She will drop by, even when we're with another one of her doctors, to make sure our child is fine. We highly recommend her.

She is an excellent pediatrician. Does General Peds and Peds-Heme/Onc. Provides sensible medical advice. Very accomodating of financial issues. My toddler son always smiles when he sees her. Office nurses are great too!
We love Dr. Ben-Isaac he has been our pediatrician for over 3 years now and we feel very fortunate to have him treat our kiddo.
Dr. Ben- Isaac is an excellent doctor.He is the best: nice, knowledgeable, and caring. It' s a real blessing that my daughter is in his care. We love him very much.
Dr. Ben-Isaac is a superb and very caring doctor. He is the best. My sons and I adore him.
Absolutely love Dr. Ben-Isaac! He has been so wonderful the past 12 years in the care of our son and his brothers. Without him, I do believe our sons would not be alive.

Dr Ben-Isaac is the best pediatrician I have ever had. My daughter has a rare condition that my family pediatrician failed to diagnose. However, when I came to seek dr. Ben-Isaac’s opinion, he not only diagnosed her, but he explained me just looking at Nicole’s blood test results, why it could not be this or that disease, but PFAPA. I was very impressed by the professionalism and knowledge level of Dr. Ben-Isaac. I was in the correspondence with him regarding my daughter’s condition. In spite of his constant business he was always fast and prompt in his replies. Later on I had concern about my son. And the way Dr. Ben-Isaac was handling my concern, by calling me with test results after his work hours , just because he knew that I was worried, by cancelling his appointments to see us as soon as he could. There is still Hope for all of us in this world if such people like Doctor Eyal Ben-Isaac exist!

Dr Ben Issac was my daughter Nia's pediatrician when she was born and for the first 9 yrs of her life she is 15 yrs old my company switched Insurancs and he was no longer with the insurance program we had at work...But he was ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL she had the best care and he is really just an excellant Pediatrician we really miss him..anyways NIA WAHL is doing outstanding...and we give Dr BEN-ISSAC applauds!!!!

Dr. Ben-Isaac has helped me keep my special needs son alive. He fights for us/him all the time. He was fast in dx'd our other son with a rare brain and spinal disorder. He is always there for us whether it is email or phone calls. He listens, he cares deeply for his patients and parents. He is also the Head of the Residency Program at Childrens. I can not say enough good things about this Dr. He is plain wonderful and we have turned down job offeres in other states to stay with Dr. Ben-Isaac. Life for parents and children would be better if there were more Dr. Ben-Isaacs in the world.
The staff and receptionist have 'NASTY' attitudes and are extremely rude. God forbid you ask any questions!!!!!

Dr Falgooni Patel is my 3 children's dr. I have two children with special needs (autism) and they absolutely LOVE her. They are petrified of anyone in a white lab coat but will willingly go to her and let themselves be checked by her. AMAZING!! She listens and I've never felt rushed or like my needs as their mom weren't being heard. I can't stop telling her that she is an angel and that I love her. She IS THEE BEST PEDIATRICIAN EVER.

Dr Patel is the best pediatrician ever. She is a true blessing. I have a 3 and a 1 year old and they just loved her. I have been to numerous pediatrician that are not half as caring as Dr Patel and her staff. I will recommend her to all friends and family.

I was referred to Dr Pratima Patel from Dr Alex Krammer who was my pediatrician back in the 60's and then took care of my 5 children until he retired. Was concerned that I would never find another pediatrician as loving,caring and personal as Dr Krammer, but in fact his referral was a blessing for my kids and my grandkids. Now my grandkids are patients of her daughter (Dr Falgooni Patel) who has taken over since her mothers passing. WE ALL MISS HER DEARLY..
very kind and spent time with us...my kids felt very comfortable and sh eas very helpful. answered all of your questions and provided helpful information. staff was nice

Dr. Patel is realy nice and my kids love her. She is patient, kind and takes her time and does not rush through appointments. The problem I have is that she practices at 2 locations (Chino Hills & Covina) which is always difficult to keep track of. Her office staff (at the Chino Hills location) is not friendly and never returns calls when she tells you she will. Her office hours are crazy, some days they are closed, some days they're closed for lunch for about 2 hours and when the operators says "they should be back from lunch in an hour", they are not. I really, like Dr. Patel but her hours, staff and 2 different locations are very inconvenient.

This woman is a gem to the medical industry. My son was a patient of her mothers, Pratima Patel. When she died, Falgooni took over the practice and is soaring with it. She may be young and new but she is a great doctor and makes herself available in ways and at times other doctors wouldn't. Dr. Patel's staff (the wonderful Delores and Maria) know me the moment I call and take care of us without hesitation, appointment or not. I love this doctor so much, if moving were ever an issue for me, continuing to have access to her would be a great deciding factor on where we would move.
nice and helpful...listened to me and offered helpful advice. Also took the time to talk to me about both my daughters

Dr. Burgamy has been our pediatrician since my 2 year old daughter was born. We love her and always feel like we are in good hands when we see her. Our son is due soon and we are so lucky we have a great pediatrician already!
Dr. Burgamy is so great. Our baby had acid reflux and she took the time to listen and figured out immediately what the problem was. We look forward to our visits with her.
Dr. Burgamy is so wonderful. She took the time to listen to my concerns and I feel my son is in great hands. She has such a great bedside manner and is really caring. We love her!!
Best pediatrician I've ever had. Listens and takes the time to understand the patient's and parent's needs.

Dr Kim has been Pediatrician for our two children and he is an extremely polite and caring doctor. I have yet to meet anyone like him. Even after having moved 10 miles from santa clara I can not think of anyone other than him as my children's doctor. Recommend him highly.

He is a excellent doctor. He is a pediatrician for my two kids for past 6.5 Years since my kids born.He is very polite,listen and answer for all the questions. He never rush(So far I never met a doctor like him). whenever I call him for Urgent care, Always get the same day late appointment and He is the last one to leave the hospital. He is the best.
This doctor is very nice to my child,is caring,nice helpful.He gives good prescriptions to me and it really cured me.I had rashes and he gave me a medicine and i got cured.So I really recommend you.
He is an excellent Pediatrician.Very patient and polite with kids.Takes time to explain.Very caring.I can't think of any other doctor for my kids.

Dr. Kim is an excellent children's doctor. He listens and tries to answer all my wife's questions, even about the smallest things or children's issues that are more general, rather than medical. He is also willing to answer many questions. He takes his time, is polite and is very friendly. He genuinely cares about all his patients. He also goes the extra mile to help out; I even heard that he carried a baby from the parking lot because the baby was too heavy for the mother. The office, especially around noon, is usually running 15-30 minutes late, which isn't unusual for a doctor's office. He is part of the Santa Clara group of Palo Alto Medical Foundation (formerly, Camino Medical Group).

Dr. Asnani is a world class pediatrician. We selected her for our newborn daughter after doing an extensive search and review of pediatricians in our area. She received great reviews and now that we are going to her, my husband and I can see why. She came to visit our newborn and us at the hospital each day we were there and really made sure all was well with all of us. She is warm, caring, and super sweet. I love how she works with our daughter and how she works with us as new parents. Dr. Asnani is super informed and knowledgeable. She takes her time to explain what she is doing and answer all of our questions. She always returns my phone calls timely and I never feel rushed in-person or over the phone. Recently, my daughter had a clogged tear duct. I did a lot of research on line on how to address and treat this common issue. When I called Dr Asnani to also get her opinion, she gave me a suggestion that I did not read anywhere in my own research - to use the nose cleaner (suction) to help remove the clog from the inside out. It was after adding in this treatment method when I really started to see the duct and eye clear. It was incredible. It is a testament to her years of experience. I feel really grateful to have such an experienced, knowledgeable, and warm pediatrician for our daughter. She comes with my highest review and recommendation.

Have switched to this pediatrician two years ago and we love her. She's definitely not in an HMO but in private practice in Los Angeles. The office is ancient and when the senior doctor retires, I hope she will do a makeover. However she's smart, sensitive, and thorough. My (pre-teen and teen) kids respect her and don't dislike going which is saying a lot. We got through all the HPV vaccines and she helped us with a possible metabolic problem as well

Dr. Asnani is the best! She is leaving the HMO world; however, because of the hassles dealing with HMO bureacracy. She knows and loves each of her patients. Our son has been with her since birth and he is a year old now. Couldn't have asked for a better pediatrician!
I'm a nervous first time parent and I absolutely LOVE Dr. Asnani! She truly loves kids and is so sweet with my daughter. She's so smart and thorough and overall wonderful.

During my visit I felt that I was treated very well.I would absolutely recommend this doctor to my family and friends.I felt this visit was an amazing success!Overall I would rate this visit : outstanding!
DrWoo is good but her nurse is horrible! no patient, doesn't care about little baby's feeling, rude! very disapointed!

I'm an RN who worked with Dr Woo at UCLA. I chose her as my daughter's pediatrician because she was knowledgable and on top of everything. She has great judgement and I trust her completely. She always calls me back promptly and give reassurance when needed. If its a well chikd visit she does not spend a lot of time but if your child is sick she will take lots of time with parent and child. She is also great at getting the kids all the services they need.

We have been seeing Dr. Woo for both our children since they were born (5&2). It took me a while to find what I love about Dr. Woo but the first time I took my first son there when he was sick (I.e. not a well visit) I found it. And while she is often rushing through well visits, I discovered why. When my boys are sick she sits down and watches them. She observes and thinks and takes her time. I love that. And as others have said she is conservative on her approach with prescriptions which I like. There have been. Couple instances when her parenting advice doesn't mesh with my style but that's ok. I'm not there for that. She's shown compassion and care, knows my children, and I trust her judgement.

The nurses are quite sweet and helpful; too bad, because Dr. Woo is not fit to be a pediatrician. While she may be a good 'Doctor' (and we do have one friend who still likes her because of her expertise), I think she is a failure as a pediatrician. She is always too harsh, too mean, too rough with my kids. She hurts their feelings, at a time when they're nervous anyway (going to Dr./getting shots.) She has zero sensitivity towards little patients. That she's also not great with the parents doesn't bother me - I can handle that. But that she's dismissive and physically and verbally unkind with the kids - not OK. I stayed with her way too long, thinking that I had to put up with this...Why?? She has an abusive personality. She is funny and even 'kind' sounding for the first 5 minutes, and then it's like she loses steam,and this other side comes out, and she can't hold in her sarcasm, criticism (of a little child!) and mean comments. Actually kind of pathetic. Poor Doc.

UNPROFESSIONAL! Dr. Woo was extremely judgmental. She was rude and had this sarcastic laugh about everything I was saying. She made me feel bad about myself as a mother. She prejudged everything even before I had the chance to answer her ques. After caring for my child over the last 5 years she was treating me like an unfit mom as if I didn't have a clue to what I was doing. Even though my child is doing extremely well in all aspects of his life, healthy and happy and above avg in brain dev and social behaviors- she kept emphasizing if there was something wrong the way I was raising him. I found her way of practice to be outdated - mother-in-law way- extremely unprofessional!

Typical crazy controlling ego driven doctor. Told me to put my 1 year old daughter on a diet because she was 75th percentile for weight, not even considering my daughter is also over 100th percentile for height. I'm 5'9 and my husband is 6'5. My daughter isnt overweight at all. She just kept comparing my daughter to her daughter and of course her daughter is tiny (she is asian!) My daughter is projected to be at least 5'10. This doctor had NO clue what she was talking about. Absurd.

She is the most pretentious doctor I have ever been too. She was rude and condescending and had no social skills whatsoever and she obviously doesn't give a damn about her patients because when I took my daughter to her she treated her more like a medical experiment instead of a human being. No compassion at all! She is missing that emotional link to her patients which scared me the most!!! If you love your baby, do not take them to her!

Dr. Woo has been seeing my first son since he was 6 months & now sees my second son. I am very happy with her & her staff. Very knowledgable & trustworthy. Office is very accomodating with same day needs.

EXCELLENT Dr.! Our son loved her and she and her staff will be missed! Very caring and always returned our calls within the hour/day. Staff friendly and always addressed us in a respectful way, very personable! Thanks again everyone!
Dr. Woo is wonderful with my daugther. She is very knowledgeable, takes time to explain things, always returns calls promptly and a very caring, nice person.
There never was a better baby or child doctor ever

Motion Picture Insurance paid quickly, Doctors office just prefers cash. Office staff always said Screen actors guild insurance not paid up to date I would call Sag office 818 954 9400 and have to wait through recording but always got through and insurance was pd. performer was retired and has lifetime insurance. children fully covered. http://www2.mbc.ca.gov/LicenseLookupSystem/PhysicianSurgeon/Lookup.aspx?licenseType=A&licenseNumber=28858 http://www2.mbc.ca.gov/LicenseLookupSystem/PhysicianSurgeon/document.aspx?path=%5cDIDOCS%5c20070907%5cDMRAAABI3%5c&did=AAABI070907222209156.DID&licenseType=A&licenseNumber=28858#page=1 . He does due house calls to newborns through certified nurse midwifes.

Dr. Fleiss and his entire staff offer the best care for kids I've ever seen. He takes his time, makes kids feel comfortable and most important. They all do everything they can to help when a child is really ill, but never rush to use strong medications when watchful waiting, fluids and simple remedies will do the job. The office is wonderful and warm, the parking right outside so you'll never have to walk miles of cold corridors carrying a sick child. If you go, you'll wonder as I do why MORE doctors can't locate their offices so thoughtfully and have staffs half as knowledgeable, kind and cheerful.
EXCELLENT DOCTOR!!! Extremely knowledgeable and informative.

Both of my kids have gone to him their entire lives (6 & 11). Dr. Fleiss, his associates, and his staff have been the best. Kind and gentle with kids. Know my kids well. Two waiting rooms; one for sick kids. Toys & books in waiting room and exam rooms. In an old house, so feels homey and warm. They have gone out of their way many times, even allowing me to be in an exam room with my sick son for 6 hours while they tried everything they could befor sending him to hospital...they even bought me lunch! He likes vaccinations, but will allow you not to do it. Does not like circumcision, does like breast feeding, but will let you make your own decisions. I cried when I learned we had to leave because of our insurance. We have Motion Picture Industry Health Plan Blue Shield which waits more than a year to reimburse. The doctor's office couldn't put up with that and had patients submit their own reimbursement forms. They don't reimburse US either, so we have to go. :(
kindest doctor I know. I brought my four babes to him.

inaccurate records kept or no records kept. Your site is blocking the Medical Board access. There is no place to put any other insurances but those you have-I had a different insurance. General American.////
Dr. Yadegarian is very thorough and knowledgeable, she is always honest and extremely patient. We never feel rushed with her.

Dr. Yadegarian is the best peditrian I have ever met, she is amazing with my boys. She is so knowledgeable and caring. I so much appreciate her professionalism, she address all my concerns and provides the best care. She and her staff take the extra mile to make our visit pleasant.
Best doctor I have ever visited. very knowledgeable. answered all of my questions kindly.. Her schedule always is full that means she is a good doctor.. I recommend everyone

My first thought was...she's too young to be a doctor but as soon as she started the visit it was obvious that she is very knowledgable and her bedside manner is wonderful. Here we are several visits later and we could not be happier with the care of our child. Only con (but I guess also a pro) is that her schedule is very full and one time the staff even asked if I wanted to see someone else in the clinic with a more open schedule...my response was No Way, Dr. Yadegarian is the best!
One of the best experiences I've had with a pediatrician. She is very professional, knowledgeable and caring.

This doctor has no idea how to diagnose. Said my daughter didnt need antibiotics and to go to school the next day, the next day I took her to a real doctor and he told me this woman has no idea what shes doing.
Dr. Yoonessi has been taking care of our children for a few years now. She is knowledgeable, attentive and accessible. We are lucky to have her taking care of our kids.

I have not met a more compassionate physician. Dr. Yoonesi goes out of her way to make her patients her top priority. She speaks with her heart and truly cares about her patients sense of well-being. She stays on top of current research and this makes me feel good. She is nothing like the in and out doctors of our generation....Dr. Yoonesi spends not just time, but quality time informing and educating us on everything surrounding our issue. Always greets us with a smile and friendly voice. I know she see's so many patients and is very busy, but when she's with us, her attention is fully on us, she's so present without a wandering mind. Such a caring, thoughtful human being!
friendly nurses, compassionate MD, would recommend. Very patient with questions
She takes excellent care of our child and most importantly truly cares and listens to each and every one of our concerns
Had a poor interaction with Dr. Yoonessi. Did not appreciate the Dr's attitude and sense of entitlement. May have been ok if I felt like they were a good Dr., which they were not.

I am very happy with Dr. Marina Burstein. My 2 kids have been her patients since 2002 and we are driving all the way from Glendale to see her. Office staff is also very nice and friendly.She always calls me back after hours, is even available on Saturdays.

Dr. Burstein cares for all THREE of our kids. Since the day they were born. The doctor is a wonderful clinician. Up-to-date on the latest literature, diagnostics, and therapeutics. Staff is always very helpful and courteous. Getting all sorts of paperwork (e.g. immunization records) is a breeze. Sometimes we have to call Dr. Burstein's office for urgent or emergent appointments. Yes, often we'd come in and the office is full of patients. And, yes, we have to wait for the doctor to get done with her earlier patients before our kids. We know that once it is our turn, she will take just as much time and just as much care with our children. Strongly disagree with complaints posted above. Dr. Burstein took care of our kids throughout all sorts of emergencies, hospitalizations, and once an ICU admission. We feel truly fortunate that she is our doctor. Recommend her services highly to anyone in need of a competent, knowledgeable, and clinically astute pediatric clinician.
THE WORST DOCTOR EVER!!! I have had way to many problems with this doctor. Save your kids and go somewhere else.

If you think this is going to be a warm and fuzzy office think again. But after your 1 hour wait, always expect at least 1 hour, you will get her knowledge and gentle shy smile. She has always called when called, always got us in when sick and treated us well. The staff is under trained and a little bit harsh.

We have been patients of Dr. Burstein for over two years since our daughter was born ans we are very thankful to her for her professional care, attention, knowledge and experience. When our girl was sick we felt she is well taken care of and there is no reason to worry about anything, we totally trust our doctor and every time she exceeded our expectations. Her ability to identify the problem and establish the right diagnosis is amazing. All the treatments she gave to our little one were very helpful and effective. We would highly recommend Dr. Burstein to every parent who has concerns about their kids health.

made appointment several weeks ahead of time. waited 3 HOURS TO SEE DR. MARINA BURSTEIN. requested records and they were incomplete and lacking important details. Staff was uncooperative and charged us $15 for one page record on immunizations we should have been given at appointment and the records lacked the detail provided by every other doctor we have seen. definitely NOT MOT. We will never go back and definitely cannot recommend Dr. Marina Burstein and her staff.
Excellent doctors, prompt, attentive. Staff is also outstanding. Will recommend highly

Dr.Bustein didnt treat my child in a good way while she was very sick. She was cold, uninterested and didnt want us fully explain what was going on with her. We were very disappointed in her care. We would not recommend her to anyone.
She diagnosed my child with ease and made sure my child was better in a few days. Marina Burstein is great.

Dr. Aviva Biederman is a terrific pediatrician. Excellent bedside manner, always thorough, and explains everything clearly. Office is clean and updated, with separate waiting area for sick kids. Her office gets pretty busy (the word is out apparently), so appointments right after lunch are the way to go.
I make the drive because Aviva is the only doctor I truly trust for my daughter. She is amazing.

Great Dr. Her name is Aviva though. I have taken my 2 boys to her since they were born. I actually changed after my second's son birth when he was a couple of months to avoid the drive, but now that he's 11 months, I am going back because she is amazing. I never left because I didn't like her. My second son had Pyloric Stenosis at 6 weeks of life and she knew it right away and made sure Radiology saw him immediately there at Cedars Sinai, even though Radiology didn't want to. She wasn't taking no for an answer. She really made me feel comfortable and comforted me. She even let me use the phone in her personal office to call my family since my cell's battery had died. For something so scary, she really made me feel great and sure about having nothing but the best Dr.s there at Cedars. I am excited to take my boys back to her and will be there late April for his 1 yr. checkup. I love the handouts she gives that apply to your child's age. She speaks great Spanish, too!!

The staff are very unprofessional and actually rude. I was quite surprise that the office manager are allowed to talk to the parents and children the way they do. The Doctors are ok if you can get past the very rude staff and the long waits in the waiting room

Every single time I brought my daughter in for cold sympoms, the office would do a nose culture to rule out bacterial infections. It gave me peace of mind to know that my daughter was not truly sick. The office never skimped on this. Aviva is a wonderful bilingual doctor with a terrific manner around children. My daughter never feared her doctor's visits. Yay Dr. Biederman!

Great doctor! I'm so happy to have found her! I switched because they don't use preservatives in their vaccines. She is so helpful and always gives me literature of things I need to know for my baby's health.

Great doctor. He is very warm and approachable. He has a great bedside manner and really seems to connect with my 6 month old. He isn't the type of doctor to hastily prescribe medications and I love that. He also returns calls very quickly. I have nothing but good things to say about him.

I brought my 2-year old in for his first visit. Dr. Glassman has a great bedside manner (he even got my son to smile) and answered all of our questions. I would recommend him to anyone. The practice is also open on Saturday and there is a doctor on call on Sundays which is a plus for any parent.

I have nothing but positives to share. Very nice and compassionate man. Very encouraging. I felt comfortable sharing my problems with him. He discussed with me important subjects such as drinking and driving, and sexual activity. I am very thankful to have grown up with this doctor; he really put me in a good direction.

Dr.Miller is a great doctor. I take my 11yr old daughter to him and my son to be 6yr old son. He was with them since day 1. Very nice professtional and has great bed side manners. Just recently i had to take my daughter in for a annual exam and had to see Dr.Ouchi. She seem to look very serious which frighten my daughter and the way she was talking scared her even more. Not sure if it was just a bad day but it made my child feel scared and that she didnt want to come back anymore i hope that next time she sees kids she will have a smile on her face.

I have to concur with the below statement a previous person left. This was our experience to the "T" with Dr. Ouchi. Great Doctor! *****************************We were transferred to Dr. Ouchi after first being a patient of Dr. Miller in this office since my son's birth. Dr. Ouchi seems capable but not overly personal. I don't think she would know me from Adam if she saw us outside of the office. I have had a great experience with the office staff (especially the receptionist) who always remembers us. It seems that the best Dr. in this office is Dr. Biederman who we've only seen once. The office is usually busy, but on time.

Dr. Ouchi has been our pediatrician for 4.5 years. She always takes time to listen to all of our concerns, returns phone calls promptly, and has an excellent rapport with our 5 year old (and us!). She does only work 3 days of the week, but we have seen Dr. Miller, when needed, on her days off and like him as well. I have recommended several friends to Dr. Ouchi and all are happy with her.

We were transferred to Dr. Ouchi after first being a patient of Dr. Miller in this office since my son's birth. Dr. Ouchi seems capable but not overly personal. I don't think she would know me from Adam if she saw us outside of the office. I have had a great experience with the office staff (especially the receptionist) who always remembers us. It seems that the best Dr. in this office is Dr. Biederman who we've only seen once. The office is usually busy, but on time.

Very limited availability makes it difficult for appointments. Very crowded waiting room with no clocks. Expensive parking and an office manager with very poor customer service skills to say the least. Unfortunately, her staff has obviosly been trained by her! If you have no other option, it is better for older kids who can wait along time to see the doctor.
Dr. Do is a great listener and thoughtful. He is knowledgeable and gives practical advice. My son, now seven, has been seeing him since birth and now my 7 month old daughter is one of his patients.

Dr Do is a great doctor. He is courteous, nice, helpful, thorough, and resourceful. He makes sure he answers any/all questions before you leave his office and if he doesn't know an answer he will certainly research it and let you know his findings ASAP.

Dr. Laura Mabie saw my sister and I through every inoculation, blood test, ear infection, fever, blood test, booster shot, hearing test, stitch,vision test, injury, and growth spurt like clockwork every 6 months ( starting from the time I took my first steps and spoke my first words (before I was even 1 year old) and finally ending nearly 18 FULL YEARS LATER when I moved up north to start college at UC Berkeley, and was no longer a child! Although I must admit that I am a bit biased, because to me, "Dr. Laura" is actually AUNT Laura, I can honest and objectively declare at my current age of 29 that not only is Dr. Laura Mabie a close and loving blood relative of mine, but she is also the BEST doctor that I have ever seen!!:0) I love you Aunt Laura!! a -your first nephew, Jason Mabie :o)
She is a very knowledgeable pediatrician who is always sensitive to the needs of children with disabilities.
Dr Gorlick is literally the best pediatrician in town he takes his time and i truly trust him!!!!
Awarded Best in California designation lst 4 years. Published. Peer reviewer. The pediatrician for many doctor's children.
I've been going to Dr. Pitts since my daughter was 2 mos and now she's 15 !! He's a great doctor !!!
help save my childs life

While I am sure that Dr Cynamon is a competent specialist, my experience with him has been to the contrary. He performed a stomach biopsy on my son, which required him to be under general anaesthesia, and did not find what he expected to see, yet based a life long diagnosis upon his finding of nothing. He has recently recommended an endoscopy for my son, which will also require general anaesthesia. I have called his office twice to speak to Dr Cynamon, neither time did I receive a call back. I believe it is time to seek a second opinion.

My son has been to a number of Dr. with 2 years of health problems and Dr. Cynamon has been amazing seeing his care thru. He truly wants to see his overall quality of life improve. I've never had a doctor follow thru with calls, tests and even with insurance like Dr. C. and his staff Becky is amazing as well. Thanks....Dr. C

He's been great! My son has been his patient for almost two years now, and he's been wonderful! He is even-tempered and kind, and great with my son. He is not condescending like many specialists can be, and he is thorough and knowledgeable.
His bedside manners were horrible. If you leave a message for him with something urgent, it can take him over a day to get back to you. He seems very removed.
I Love Dr. Maher. She is a fabulous Pediatrician. She always treats us well and she answers any questions that you might have.

She's an amazing doctor. I am always impressed after each visit. She always makes time for her patients, quick to return phone calls, has great bedside manners with my little ones, my big ones, and the parents.
Both of our children see Dr. Nam-Choi and we have been delighted with her.

She is an outstanding pediatrician. Very sensible, knowledgeable, and practical. Knows how to establish rapport with difficult children (i.e., my son). She is personable and her medical advice is spot-on.

I brought my daughter in to see Dr. Garfias today for the first time and we absolutely love her! She introduced herself and talked to my daughter for a bit so she would feel comfortable before examining her. She asked a lot of questions, thoroughly explained her diagnosis to us and never made us feel rushed. Dr. Garfias has an excellent bedside manner! I wish I had found her years ago!
The best pediatrician ever. After three kids and many doctors, I finally found one that is caring to the child and parent. She listens and explains very well. There should be more like her.

He is very knowledgable, respectful, and gentle. My children adore and idolize him. He has so many years of experience that he usually knows what's going on with my kids before I even finish my sentence. He asks all the right questions and treats my concerns with respect and medically sound advice; of course, you have to give him detailed answers to his specific questions and accurate descriptions of symptoms so that he can use the correct information to diagnose your child. He always returns my calls promptly, even after-hours - he took the time to help me find a 24-hour pharmacy near my home and called in a prescription in the wee morning hours on more than one occasion. He has great relationships with the nearby hospitals, doctors, and staff and communicates with them even before your arrival to ensure his patients receive the best care and service. He was my doctor as a child. He helped us through a very difficult month when our toddler was very ill. Years ago, when my brother was 16, he was misdiagnosed and mistreated by several doctors before my mother finally called Dr. Minassian - the only person she rightfully trusted. Dr. Minassian was able to correctly diagnose my brother with a leaking appendix over the phone, and contacted the right people to get him into an emergency surgery. Within a couple hours. Dr. Minassian saved his life. Now, as a mother, I can't imagine taking my kids to anyone else.

VERY SCARY This doctor misdiagnosed both my kids with pneumonia and bronchitis, took them in 3 or 4 times and he kept telling me nothing was wrong, so I got fed up went to the ER and boy am I glad I did, he also prescribed medicine with the wrong dosage to my 6 month old baby that I didn't catch til later on after he had taken it all!

DR. MINASSIAN IS THE BESTTTTTTTTTTTTTT PEDIATRICIAN OUT THERE, HE IS SO CARING AND SO WONDERFUL AND MOST IMPORTANT, HE KNOWS WHAT HE IS DOING. HE SAVED MY BABIES LIFE. I TOOK HER TO A DIFFERENT DOCTOR, AND THEY FAILED TO DIAGNOSE THAT SHE HAD AN INFECTION IN HER EAR, BECASUE SHE WAS 2 WEEKS OLD. DR MINASSIAN KNEW FROM ONE LOOK EXACTLY WHAT IT WAS WITHOUT EVEN TESTING HER. SHE HAD STAPH INFECTION IN HER EAR, AND IF IT DIDNT GET THE PROPER CARE SHE WOULD HAVE DIED. I AM BLESSED TO HAVE FOUND DR MINASSIAN.
I love doctor pang, she's been my doctor since I was a baby.

We interviewed Dr. Pang when I was 9 months pregnant. We had a lot of questions about vaccines, but ultimately decided on vaccinating. We were OK with her and selected her as our daughter's primary care physician. We didn't see Dr. Pang again until after the birth while we were in the hospital. I was suffering from horrible post partpartum depression and when the nurses called Dr. Pang in because I was afraid to give my baby to the nurse for a checkup Dr. Pang suggested that I find another pediatrician because I was refusing care and that our decision not to vaccinate didn't fit the practice. HELLO!? I wasn't refusing care! I was asking questions! And who said I wasn't vaccinating?! I just asked questions, very reasonable questions and for her advice. I have NEVER had a doctor suggest we find other care. We were at our greatest need while in the hospital I was confused and TERRIFIED only to have this judgmental and arrogant woman suggest we go elsewhere with our "concerns" was horrid.
Dr. Pang is an excellent pediatrician, she's great with kids and always takes the time to discuss all concerns at each visit.

Dr. Geffner sets the standars. Truly the best of the best! Dr. Geffner is an amaazingly caring man, as well as a dedicated, passionate, brillant doctor. If you are lucky enough to get an appointment with Dr. Geffner (he books up months in advance, and you do have to wait quite a while sometimes once you get there, but truly worth the wait!) you can be sure you are in the best of hands!
I adore Dr. Geffner. He is kind, patient, incredibly caring, and gentle. I've never met another doctor like him, and I've seen a lot of doctors!
She is the best doctor I ever had. Great bedside manners. Takes time with all of her patients.

He has always been warm and friendly--remembers the last visit and always is very knowledgeable.
DR. ZIBARI DOES NOT ACKNOWLEDGE HARD THE NURSING STAFF WORKS. THERE IS NO "THANK YOU" FROM HIM. THERE ARE NURSES OUT ON STRESS LEAVE DUE TO HIM. N
She is one of the best pediatrician at UCLA I highly recommend her.

Took my son to see her for plagiocephaly. She examined him and told me his head was improving, despite my insistence to the contrary and the fact that she had never actually seen him before! Because of her assessment we were unable to start helmet therapy in a timely fashion, and now my son's head will never fully correct. Stay away, she doesn't know her limitations which is the most dangerous.

Took my child for an illness that has been going on for a while. Waited for exactly 1 hr! Didn't seem to take personal interest at all.
The best endocrinologist is Dr Lynda Fisher..I was her patient for many years and have learned so much from her. She always took the time to educate me on my T1D and provided the best care.

My past experiences with Dr. Fisher have been nothing but frustrating! ALWAYS very late, not just a little late; not really listening to what her patient is saying or feeling or her parents! Childhood diabetes is so much more than readings and stats! They need to be able to feel they can vent their frustrations and get the feeling about this unbelievably difficult disease to deal with - especially for a young child/preteen! No beside manner - always seemed irritated with troubles or questions presented to her! Knowledgable - yes, absolutely....but there is so much more than that which make for a good doctor/patient relationship...

I must disagree with the previous comment. I was Dr. Fisher's patient when I was a kid for many years (I am 22 now and no longer with her). I agree that she is a very busy lady and runs late on her appointment. HOWEVER, she is an amazing doctor with so much knowledge! She seems to really care about her patients. Yes, she seems overloaded with patients, but her whole endocrinology team will do the best to give you the best treatment for your diabetes, or what may have you. I would recommend her.

I'm very disappointed with the care my daughter receives with Dr. Fisher. Dr. Fisher is extremely busy and is always in a rush and rarely on time. She often is distracted and doesn't listen very well. She's unavailable in emergencies, and doesn't respond to messages or emails when contacted in a timely manner. Refill approval for medications are slow and often take nearly two weeks to be approved. Her schedule is so books that it's impossible to get appointments within a reasonable amount of time. She's typically out of town or out of the country. She doesn't provide through medical care, rarely running blood panels to monitor effects of medications. Her diagnosis of the type of disorder my daughter has was flat out wrong as well and she lacks knowledge of the disorder in general. For being one of the best in the field she has not proven to be very good for my daughter.

I've been taking both of my babies there and Dr. Aboulian is excellent. She's very nice, sweet, caring and answers all your questions. On a different not the staff is Horrible! They lack of customer service, knowledge about insurance and defiantly if your not Hispanic they can care less about having you wait or get any help! The Manager Elizabeth Gonzalez is VERY Unprofessional! She was fired from her previous job because she has no customer service skills, no manners, no class, I mean shes just a very uneducated lady! My daughters will no longer be going there! I switched them over finally to a nice clinic in glendale! Oh, manager has no problem to making threats which lead me to go file a police report :) good luck to those who continue or begin to go there. Dr. Luna owns the practice and she also practices there too but she has no control over how unprofessional her office is! Sorry Dr. Aboulian you are a very nice, sweet, knowledgeable pediatrician but unfortunately your working with those who are going to lower your patient count and play with your reputation!

Very disappointing , will not recommend her at all, appointments is not on time , the staff r rude ! So sorry to write this review , but seriously I had the worse experience ever in my whole life with this office!

Dr. Larry Yin and his team did an autism assessment for my younger sister who recently moved in with me and were so helpful and accommodating in every way. I love her!! So much patience with my kids and she is so knowledgable about everything. She explains everything in detail and actually takes her time with asking about our concerns and all. My kids love her too! :)

Great with my kids! I highly recommend this doctor because i left the appointment with more knowledge about my child's disease, comfort in knowing that she really cares, and confidence that we're going to work together in my child's care.

Dr. Huang and Elizabeth Giron LVN are great, approachable and accommodating. They go the extra mile to ensure that my son's care plan is working for him. I highly recommend the School Clinic team without reservation.

Back in 2006 I ended up having Dr. Absood as a fill-in doctor & it was meant to be ... Because of her knowledge, diligence & willingness to go the extra mile by sending me to the specialists I needed, she discovered I had a rare chronic illness! She has a great bedside manner & she is very professional. I hated losing her as a doctor & I would recommend her to anyone! Doctor's like Dr. Absood are a dying class!
very humble the staff is great theres never much waiting and my phone calls are always returned with in 5 min to 30 min. Very calm doctor that will never give ur child anything he wont his own.

Dr. Kesler has been my kids' pediatrician since birth (they are now 6yo and 3yo). While his views are much more mainstream than my own (pro-vax, pro-intervention) I have always found him to be respectful of my views and willing to listen to what I have to say. What I appreciate most about him is his willingness to learn something - when I pointed out to him that the handout being distributed at the 1yr well-baby check contained erroneous information about carseat safety and provided him with supporting documents from the AMA, he started giving the parents of his patients more accurate information. That's the kind of thing I REALLY appreciate in a doctor. My kids both adore Dr. Kesler and he seems to genuinely like children and like helping them. Over the past few years, I have come to trust him deeply - and as protective as I am of my children, that is saying a LOT. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Dr. Kesler to anyone.

She is amazing!! She is always available, & she is very knowledgeable. She is also very approachable. She forwards all her office calls to her cell phone, so her patients can reach her at any time. Dr. Queen is a very caring doctor. She makes it a point to give the best care possible. She made us feel that our children were not numbers to her. They were important to her. She didn't waste time. She gave us all the information available. She is the BEST!

I brought my kids to Dr. Fisher for 7 years but we have really been let down. She'll treat your kids if they have a common illness that's treatable, but our daughter had a complicated health issue & we were relying on Dr. Fisher to help us coordinate her care & wow were we disappointed. She told us to just follow what the specialists said, even when they contradicted each other. I know she comes across as very outgoing, but when we pushed her for help & she became defensive & rude. Honestly, we felt she wasn't interested in anything we had to say & was always rushing us out of the office. My theory is that she felt guilty she missed our kid's diagnosis for 4-1/2 years, so she didn't want to deal with us. And yes, after all these years, the staff is RUDE RUDE RUDE.

Unfortunately I cannot recommend this practice at all. While the doctors are at least sometimes helpful (and we fortunately did not have any med crisis to deal with, so I don't know how knowledgeable they are), their office staff is impossible to deal with - always incredibly rude. So I'm stressed out by the time we even get to see the doctor.

I am on the hunt for the perfect place. I met with Dr. Fisher today. She was in her lobby talking with another couple and pulled us into her office afterwards to talk to us. Love her outgoing personality, but the front office was not as outgoing. Really at a crossroads. Her personality is A+, her education is tops along with her knowledge, but from the reviews on here and other places has me second guessing as of now. I think a front office set's the tone for the rest of the place. One big plus is Free Parking and location. I will have to sleep on this for a bit...

I went to this office since my daughter was born. Dr. Fisher provides great care for my daughter. She is an amazingly intelligent and understanding pediatrician, and we are very happy to have found her.

This is one of the worst pediatric you could have in the Culvercity area. We had a visit as his office because my daughter had a cold. Dr. Sakhai and his staff are truly wonderful. They have been taking care of my two year old since day 2. He does not rush. Did not diagnose my child's pneumonia. Had to see a specialist after a month of her doing nothing.

I've seen Dr. Koursh regularly with my daughter in her first year of life. I initially liked that Dr. Koursh was direct with his opinions about caring for children but as my confidence as a parent grew his condescending and arrogant tone began to really bother me. He asked the same questions during each checkup-feeling more like and oral exam rather than an exchange between a doctor and parents. He has ONE method for parents to follow and if you deviate from it at all he delivers a vague threat of causing our child trauma "later." For example: WE REFUSE to let our child cry-it out or night wean. We have respectfully stated this and yet he still persists claiming that we will eventually tire of it. (He speaks to us as if this decision was a trend.) He can't respect even the subtle deviations from his working model. He was also MUCH more of a lecturer when my husband was not with with me on visits. He smiles a lot but this guy lacks respect for any opinion other than his own.

I took my toddler in a couple of times to see this doctor. Most times, I had to wait 20+ minutes after my appointment time. She might be a knowledgeable doctor, I don't know, but half of being a doctor is helping a patient not only get better, but feel better. She basically told me I was focusing too much on the thing I took my toddler in to see her for, that she doesn't see what I'm seeing and that there was nothing to worry about. She probably felt like I was wasting her time, well, I kind of walked away feeling like I just wasted mine.
Do not trust your kids to her inexperienced hands. I will not, never ever agian!

She contradicted herself several times during our appointment. Her interpretation of our daughter's background info was incorrect. We had to go through notes and medical records to correct this several times. I think she cared but just wasn't sure how to help.

Dr. Hanson is a very knowledgeable pediatric neurologist. She has been an advocate for kids for a long time and she knows her stuff. She is very thorough and even though she is older, she hasn't lost her skills.

Got MD degree in 1963. We have 4 children who were diagnosed with Chiari syndrome by world expert neurosurgeon Dr. Bolognese of the Chiari Institute in NY. My daughter has a diagnosis of Chiari by 2 prominent southern CA neurosurgeons. She was diagnosed with syringomyelia by 3 prominent southern CA neurosurgeons. She has chronic pain and can not keep up with classmates. My son 15 and a half has staring episodes. We went to Dr. Hanson because we needed follow up our insurance would cover. Dr. Hanson reported my son's episodes so that he can not get a drivers license and prescribed a psychotropic drug for my daughter as she insisted that there was nothing wrong them. As we left she told me how lucky I was that my children did not have anything wrong with them. She is going to write a letter to insurance stating that there is nothing wrong with my children.
one word: Pissy! She is quick to judge and does not listen to patient concerns.
absolutely worst doctor. My son was under his care at Sunset PICU. This guy does not know what is a good service. Not responsive to parents at all. I left KASIER after 17 yrs because of him.
Dr. Pennisi is pretty out of touch with current medical trends and information. He misdiagnosed my child. I was not impressed with his information and his bedside manner is very unfriendly!
I cannot recommend Dr. Desai.

My 11 year old daughter and I met with Dr. Cheung 4 times in 2013. He was condescending to my daughter, addressing her as you would a five year old. He kept on interrupting me to ask if my daughter understood some medical terminology and certain vocabulary words I was using. All that would have been tolerated but he was completely incompetent in his handling of her case. He wanted to order STIM tests and x-rays that we had completed and we had given him. It seemed like we had to explain everything to him each time we visited. I don't think he even looked at her file at all/ When I questioned his knowledge of her case, he blamed the computer system. He was also completely unresponsive via emails and phone. We waited for over an hour to see him on our last visit. Again, he gave us incorrect information about our daughter. We are in the process of filing a complaint against this doctor. A FRUSTRATING WASTE OF AN ENTIRE YEAR OF MY CHILD'S LIFE, still no answer re her condition

I am giving here zero stars, she in uncouth, extremely rude and unprofessional. She should not be practicing medicine at White Memorial Hospital, it being a teaching hospital especially with kids or anyone for that matter. My son is a special needs child and eventhough I clearly have told her a couple of times what his disabilities are she continued to belittle us and ignore them. I am definitely swithching endocronologist.

This Dr.was so incredibly rude to me and my daughter that we changed Physicians immediately! She was extremely uncouth and talked down to me and my child never wanted to see her again! We loved Dr. Borut who was retiring. I believe Amy Vedin should not be practicing around little children. She definitely doesn't listen to her patients or the parents. It's a shame she is being paid to work around little innocent children that have to take her abuse.
Doesn't listen to parents concerns. Acts as an arrogant high school dude. Lacks maturity and compassion.
Seemed not too concerned about a very seriously ill little boy.

She made a misdiagnosis in my case and over looked a potentially fatal heart disease I had for years. If you think something is wrong,look into getting a second opinion. It could save your child's life.

Dr. Ettenger is a fantastic doctor. I see him for ped. kidney transplant, and he is super knowledgeable. ALWAYS takes everything into consideration before making a decision. Wonderful team of docs. at UCLA.
VERY NICE,KIND , AND KNOWLEGABLE

Dr. Scanlon found an asthma medication for my son that changed the quality of his life and ours. He has suffered from severe asthma since he was six months old and was hospitalized dozens of times. My son has not been to the hospital for at least six months. He even made it through one of the toughest cold and flu seasons.
They just don't get any better! I wouldn't take my kids to anyone else. Top ped. asthma specialist, knows latest research, humble, loving, considerate, fun, and the kids love her!

Dr. Feldman is very kind and very cautious. He helped us through a wicked bout of croup, during which we ended up in the hospital overnight. My son loves him! We wish we could have stayed with him, but my insurance changed with my job.
This Doctor is a terrific diagnostician and very good at making sure that children are referred on to other specialists when even the smallest problems appear. Some find him gruff but we love him!!!!
poor knowledge, poor behavior with his pts

The staff in so unorganized, the waiting area is so small only a couple of seats, the facility have a couple of examination rooms, but the worst is the time you wait in this place to see the doctor, just to end up spending 15-20 minutes of her time. NOT RECOMMENDED!!
NOT PROFESSIONAL NOR FRIENDLY
Impossible to get an appointment with her. When we were seen by other staff due to urgency, the other staff were horrible. We had to wait in a tiny offer for over an hour.

Dr Setoguchi will only prescribe the lowest cost and least functional prosthetic components. He will ridicule and belittle your child with idiotic statements about how they need to lose weight or get job while providing the worst medical care you will ever experience. Do yourself a favor and avoid this egotistical idiot.
This doctors makes decisions in regards to what treatments Blue Cross would cover or not. He received bonuses for denying treatment and saving his corporation money. He should be sanction!!
Absolutely awful to my young son. He sId he was making up his symptoms. Turns out he had a tumor .

My mother was admitted at Little Company of Mary on April 4th of this year 2014 due to electrolyte imbalance, high ammonia level and petechiae.
During her stay and under the care of Dr. Rudo Benjamin, Carl Feld and David Scott at LCM my mother was severely edematous, was having kidney failure and was having a hard time breathing. Seeing her condition worsening, I requested for her to be released from LCM.
Unfortunately the only way for my mother to be transported to my house was through hospice and I had no choice but to enroll her through Trinity Hospice.
Based on test results that I was able to obtain after my mother's death, I learned my mother was administer vancomycin at toxic levels. Based on what I read, one of the side effects of vancomycin in the elderly is decreased or closing of renal function and that is exactly what was happening to my mother. This information was never related to me on her release or thereafter. Had I been notified of this, I would have had the opportunity to take her to another hospital.
I still do not know what bacterial infection they were treating because based on her both blood culture test came back negative.
During her care through Trinity Hospice, I requested a blood test to see how her electrolyte and ammonia levels were. The hospice doctor refused to authorize the blood test and would only authorize if I paid for it. Payment for me was the never the issue. She gave me the prescription but did not provide the services. My mother was bed-bound, so attempting the process of getting this service was not easy. Unfortunately, I was never able to get this done because my mother's condition worsened and she passed away.
It is my believe that under LCM and Trinity Hospice's care contributed to my mother's death.
